titleStmt.title: Elhannon Jones, David Y. Lyttle, and R. Boyd to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7409

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his excellency Thomas E. Bramlett
Gov, of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

your petitioner Elhannon Jones states that at the August term of Laurel Circuit Court 1865 he was fined the Sum of twenty Dollars for playing a game of Cards at Bushe's store he states that the same was merely for amusement a treat being bet on the game he states that he is no gambler only plays for amusement occasionally he hopes your excellency will remit said fine

Elhannon Jones Ptr
David Y. Lyttle
R. Boyd
I hope that you will remit this fine In my opinion it ought to be done
I asigne the within as Sheriff Clay Co, Ky Thos Cook S, C, C

Laurel Cir Ct
vs
Elhannon Jones
$20,
Gaming
Remitted 23d Dec/65
